name: 曾妍潔
objective:
摘要Abstract:
基礎知識與定義、大氣汙染、空氣汙染物、水文循環、水質處理、水汙染、固體廢棄物、大地汙染、噪音汙染、工業廢氣處理。
Basics and definitions, atmospheric and land pollution, air pollutants, hydrology, water pollution and treatment, solid waste, noise pollution, industrial exhaust air treatment.


說明Directions:
地球資源有限但人類需求無限，生態環境問題日益嚴重，能源與環境的可持續發展成為地球永續的重要議題；「永續」是個重大命題，工程師在從事永續設計時，必須仔細審視天然資源和環境上的挑戰。本門課程將以環境工程學中的空氣、水、音、廢棄物處理等基本理論帶入能源領域，期盼學生們能理解能源與冷凍空調工程師對於地球永續的責任，倘若面臨工程與環境的抉擇時，能做出正確判斷為人類與地球盡可能做到保護與發展平衡之雙贏局面。
    The earth's resources are limited but human needs are unlimited. The ecological and environmental problems are becoming increasingly serious. Sustainable development of energy and the environment has become an important issue for the sustainability of the earth. "Sustainable development" is a major proposition, when designing sustainable operations, engineers must carefully examine natural resources and environmental challenges.
    This course will bring basic theories of air, water, sound and waste treatment...etc. in environmental engineering into the energy field, we look forward to understanding the energy and refrigerating Air-conditioning engineers' responsibility for the sustainability of the earth, If we are faced with the choice between engineering and the environment, we can make a correct judgment as a win-win situation in which human beings and the earth can achieve as much protection and development balance as possible.
schedule:
[Week 1]
第1章 緒論  Introduction
1.1 環境問題之成因及分類 
Causes and classification of environmental problems.
1.2 全球環境發展動向與展望 Trends and prospects of global environmental development.
1.3 重要環保公約 Important conventions on environmental protection.
1.4 ISO 14000 國際環保標準與永續發展
 ISO 14000 International environmental standards and sustainable Development

[Week 2~3]
第2章 水污染概論 Introduction to Water Pollution
2.1 水污染之來源 Source of water pollution
2.2 河川污染/ 河川污染評估 River pollution/ Assessment of river pollution
2.3 優養化/水質管理 Eutrophication/ Management of water quality

第3章 污水處理與水質處理 Sewage and water treatment
3.1 污水收集 Sewage collection
3.2 廢污水處理概論 Introduction to Wastewater Treatment
3.3 給水工程計畫概論 Introduction to Water Supply Projects
3.4 水質標準/取水/導水/抽水 Water quality standard / water intake / water transfer / pumping
3.5 淨水概論 (混凝/沈澱/過濾/消毒/高級處理）Introduction to water purification (coagulation / sedimentation / filtration / sterilization / advanced treatment)
3.6 配水概論 Introduction to Water Distribution

[Week 4]
第4章 廢棄物處理與有害廢棄物 Waste treatment and hazardous waste
4.1 廢棄物之定義及處理 Definition and treatment of waste
4.2 垃圾量及質/垃圾收集與清運及資源回收 Amount and type of garbage / garbage collection and removal and resource recovery
4.3 廢棄物處理概論 (焚化/堆肥/最終處置) Introduction to Waste Treatment (Incineration / Composting / Final Disposal)

[Week 5] 期中考

[Week 6~8]
4.4 有害事業廢棄物的認定標準 Criteria for the identification of hazardous business waste
4.5 廢棄物處理技術 Waste treatment technology
4.6 有害廢棄物管理 Management of hazardous waste

第5章 空氣污染 Air pollution
5.1 空氣污染管理與法規 Air pollution management and regulations
5.2 污染物分析及濃度表示法 Pollutant analysis and concentration representation
5.3 污染物標準指標 Indicators of pollutant standards
5.4 粒狀污染物特性 Characteristics of granular pollutants
5.5 粒狀污染物控制概論 Introduction to Control of Particulate Pollutants
5.6 氣狀污染物防制 Prevention of gaseous pollutants

[Week 9~11]
5.7 移動性污染源控制 Control of mobile pollution sources
5.8 氣象學Meteorology
5.9 室內空氣污染 Indoor air pollution

第6章 噪音污染防制 Prevention of noise pollution
6.1 噪音基本特性、分貝運算及衰減 Basic characteristics of noise, decibel calculation and attenuation
6.2 噪音之評估指標 Evaluation index of noise
6.3 噪音之控制 Noise control
6.4 噪音污染評估 Assessment of noise pollution

[Week 12~13]
第7章 土壤污染與地層下陷/毒性化學物質管理與風險評估 Soil pollution and formation subsidence / toxic chemical management and risk assessment
7.1 土壤污染/土壤及地下水污染整治技術概論 Introduction to soil pollution / remediation techniques for soil and groundwater pollution
7.2 風險評估 Risk assessment
7.3 毒性化學物質管理 Management of toxic chemicals

第8章 環境影響評估與管理 Environmental Impact Assessment and Management
8.1 環境影響評估與管理 Environmental Impact Assessment and Management

[Week 14] 期末考
scorePolicy:

Attendance accounts for 50% of the total grade, 20% for mid-term exams, and 30% for final exams.
